action.action-desc: Mr. Van Drew introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to establish a counseling program for certain survivor of veterans deceased as the result of suicide.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Green Star Families Act.

section.header: Counseling program for certain family members and caregivers of veterans deceased as a result of suicide

subsection.text: Subchapter II of chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Counseling program for certain family members and caregivers of veterans deceased as a result of suicide

paragraph.text: Subject to paragraph (2), the Secretary shall furnish, at no cost to the recipient, counseling services to—

subparagraph.text: the next of kin of covered veterans; and
former volunteer caregivers of covered veterans.

paragraph.text: The Secretary may provide counseling services under this section only if the Secretary determines such counseling services are—

subparagraph.text: reasonably accessible to the an individual described in paragraph (1); and
substantially equivalent or superior to similar services furnished by the Secretary to an individual described in paragraph (1).

paragraph.text: To carry out subsection (a), the Secretary may enter into an agreement with a Federal, State, or private entity. The Secretary may provide fair compensation to such entity pursuant to such agreement.

subsection.text: In carrying out the program under subsection (a), the Secretary shall—

paragraph.text: publish information relating to the program on an internet website of the Department; and
provide information relating to the program to any individual described in paragraph (1).
The terms covered veteran and next of kin has the meaning given that term in section 904 of title 36.
The term covered veterans service organization includes—

subparagraph.text: an organization recognized by the Secretary for the representation of veterans under section 5902 of this title; and

clause.text: that is described in section 501(c)(3) or 501(c)(19) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and is exempt from taxation under section 501(a) of such Code; and
that carries out activities relating to veterans and their assistance.

paragraph.text: The term family member means, with respect to a covered veteran, an individual—

subparagraph.text: who is a member of the family of the veteran, including—
who, prior to the death of the covered veteran, lived with the covered veteran.

paragraph.text: The term former volunteer caregiver means, with respect to a covered veteran, an individual—

subparagraph.text: who is at least 18 years of age; and

who, prior to the death of the covered veteran, and in connection with a covered veterans service organization, furnished the covered veteran with counseling, social work, or other personal care services—

clause.text: without compensation to such individual; and
for a period of at least three months.

paragraph.text: The term personal care services has the meaning given that term in section 1720G of this title.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of subchapter II of chapter 17 of such title is amended by inserting, after the item relating to section 1720J, the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 1720K. Counseling program for certain family members and caregivers of veterans deceased as a result of suicide.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall carry out section 1720K of such title, as added by subsection (a), by not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
